intro: Alysicarpus obovatus, commonly known as the broad-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, obovate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an annual herb and is often found in disturbed soils. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its spread.
